001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.retry;
002
003import java.util.function.Function;
004import java.util.function.Predicate;
005
006/**
007 * Represents a condition to be checked repeatedly until it succeeds or times out.
008 *
009 * <p>Implementations of this interface define two key elements:
010 * <ul>
011 *   <li>A {@link #function()} that produces a value to be evaluated.</li>
012 *   <li>A {@link #condition()} that tests the produced value for success.</li>
013 * </ul>
014 * This pattern allows for flexible retry logic, where an operation can be invoked repeatedly
015 * until the returned value satisfies the specified condition.
016 *
017 * <p>This interface is often used in conjunction with a retry mechanism that repeatedly calls
018 * the {@code function()} until the {@code condition()} is met or a timeout is reached.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public interface RetryCondition<T> {
023
024   /**
025    * Produces a value to be evaluated by the retry logic.
026    *
027    * <p>This function is typically called repeatedly by a retry mechanism until
028    * the result satisfies the corresponding {@link #condition()}.
029    *
030    * @return a {@link Function} that takes an {@code Object} (e.g., a service or context)
031    *     and returns a value of type {@code T} for evaluation.
032    */
033   Function<Object, T> function();
034
035   /**
036    * Evaluates the value produced by {@link #function()} to determine success.
037    *
038    * <p>If this predicate returns {@code true}, the retry mechanism can stop. Otherwise,
039    * the retry mechanism continues to invoke {@code function()} until a timeout is reached.
040    *
041    * @return a {@link Predicate} that tests the value of type {@code T} for success.
042    */
043   Predicate<T> condition();
044
045}
